articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Vice-FM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Vice-FM
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 On the occasion Zhang Zhijun hoped that the Korean people would register greater success in socialist construction under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in various fields.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Chinese Vice-FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Chinese Vice-FM
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a friendly talk with Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday when they paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese Guests
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese Guests
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					 It was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Monday by Zhang Zhijun.

articles.title: Chinese Guests Visit Several Places
articles.content:
Chinese Guests Visit Several Places
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Zhang Zhijun, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of China, and his party visited the e-library of Kim Chaek University of Technology Monday.
					 Being briefed on the modern library they went round reading halls, a remote lecture room, etc.
					
					 They laid a wreath before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers in Hyongjesan District the same day. They also visited the Pyongyang Metro.

articles.title: Memorial Service Commemorates Death Anniversary of Han Tok Su
articles.content:
Memorial Service Commemorates Death Anniversary of Han Tok Su
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- A national memorial service was held at the People's Palace of Culture Monday to commemorate the tenth anniversary of death of Han Tok Su, former chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 Attending the service were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, officials of power organs, public organizations, religious organizations, educational organs, ministries and national institutions, bereaved family members, working people in the city of Pyongyang and officials of Chongryon and Japan-residing Koreans staying in the socialist homeland.
					
					 Han was born into a poor peasant family in Kyongsan County, North Kyongsang Province. He organized the labor movement for the right to existence of Koreans in Japan from his early years. 
					
					 After the country's liberation Han worked hard to rally broad strata of Koreans in Japan around President Kim Il Sung true to his letter "To One Million Koreans in Japan". He devoted his all to the patriotic work for the building of a new country.
					
					 He organized Chongryon, overseas Koreans' organization of the DPRK, and worked as its chairman for 46 years.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop in his memorial address said: Han rendered distinguished services for the development of the overseas Koreans movement.
					
					 He shared weal and woe with the socialist homeland, considering it as mother's embrace even though he was in an alien land.
					
					 Han was a genuine son of the nation who embarked upon the path of patriotism following the President and steadfastly covered it generation after generation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. His noble life and feats will go down in the history of the country and always remain shining along with the revolutionary cause of Juche and the patriotic cause of Chongryon making dynamic progress.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Han Tok Su
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Han Tok Su
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the grave of Han Tok Su, former chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery on Monday on the occasion of his 10th death anniversary.
					Seen before it was a wreath sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Yong Dae, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Social Democratic Party, officials of power organs, public organizations, national institutions and educational organs, those concerned, bereaved families, working people in the city, Pae Jin Gu, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, other officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths in the name of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, the DPRK Cabinet, the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, public organizations, national institutions, universities, etc. and bouquets.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Han Tok Su.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Cambodia
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Cambodia
						
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- King Norodom Sihamoni and Great King Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia sent big floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 A delegation of the Cambodian Ministry of Royal Palace headed by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, visited the embassy on Feb. 15 to lay the floral baskets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Floral Baskets and Gifts to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Baskets and Gifts to Kim Jong Il 
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with floral baskets and gifts by foreigners on the occasion of his birthday. Floral baskets came from the leader of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist) and the mayor of Nakhodka of Russia while gifts from the president of the Commerce and Industry and Real Estate Investment Company at Latakia Province in Syria and the chairman of the KAM International Group of Kuwait.
					 They were handed to DPRK officials active in those countries in the period between Feb. 9 and 16.

articles.title: 15th Kimjongilia Festival Closes
articles.content:
15th Kimjongilia Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The 15th Kimjongilia Festival was closed with due ceremony at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on Monday. It was opened on Feb. 14 on the occasion of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday. 
					 Present at the ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, officials of ministries and national institutions, service personnel, working people, school youth and children and the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Addressing the ceremony, Minister of Culture An Tong Chun referred to the fact that the 15th Kimjongilia Festival was held with splendor as a festival in praises of the great man.
					
					 He stressed the need to boost the exchange and cooperation on the achievements and experience gained in cultivating and propagating the flowers of the sun in the future, too, to keep them in fuller bloom.

articles.title: Technological Updating of Light Industrial Establishments Makes Brisk
articles.content:
Technological Updating of Light Industrial Establishments Makes Brisk
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Technological updating is now making brisk headway in the field of light industry in the DPRK, laying a solid foundation for improving the standard of the people's living in the near future.
					 Production processes have been technologically updated at the Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Sinuiju Textile Mill and the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory while the Hamhung Woolen Mill witnessed the construction of vinalon fiber and yarn production process. 
					
					 The Pothonggang Shoes Factory, the Sinuiju Shoes Factory and the Wonsan Boots and Shoes Factory and other shoes factories of the country have succeeded in raising the level of technological updating.
					
					 The Pyongyang Flour-Processing Factory, the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, the Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory and combined foodstuff factories in various provinces have been technologically updated to bring about a signal boost in the foodstuff production.
					
					 Modern local industrial factories have sprung up in different provinces, cities and counties to turn out peculiar products.
					
					 Progress has been made in the efforts to tap locally available raw materials for production.
					
					 Recently, the Stevia Processing Factory succeeded in producing saccharic powder with stevia, opening the prospect of solving the problem of raw material for saccharin by an indigenous way.

articles.title: Coal Production Goes Up
articles.content:
Coal Production Goes Up
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The coal mines across the country are reporting signal successes in the production of coal.
					 According to data available, thousands of more tons of coal have been produced on a daily average in February than that in January.
					
					 The Anju Area Coal Complex is overfulfilling its daily plans for coal production and pit tunneling on indices, while pushing forward the projects for the expansion of production capacities at the Hwaphung, Ryongrim and Ripsok coal mines.
					
					 The February 8 Jiktong Youth Coal Mine, Chonsong Youth Coal Mine, Jenam Coal Mine and the Ryongdung Coal Mine, the nation's leading coal producers, keep the coal production going at a high rate to supply more coal to thermal-power plants, metal and chemical factories and light industrial establishments.
					
					 Similar successes in the coal production were reported from the coal mines in the western region of the country and those in Kyongwon and Onsong areas, the area of South Hamgyong Province, and Myongchon and Chonnae areas. 
					
					 In the meantime, the coal mining machine plants in different parts of the country are supplying a lot of parts of equipment and tools to coal mines.

articles.title: Indigenous Style Production Process of Vitamin C Established
articles.content:
US Urged to Stop Projected War Exercises against DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification demanded the U.S. stop the moves for war exercises against the DPRK.
					 A commentary made public by it on Feb. 17 accused the U.S. of working hard to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises with the south Korean authorities with huge troops involved.
					
					 Last year the U.S. instigated the south Korean authorities to wage war maneuvers year-round under the pretext of Cheonan warship sinking, driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the phase of an all-out war, it said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. plan of war exercises reveals its attempt to escalate confrontation on the Korean Peninsula and put the finishing touches on the triangular military alliance with Japan and south Korea.
					
					 Its war scenario can never come true, the commentary said. It demanded the U.S. halt at once the planned exercises.

articles.title: Nano-Germicide for Agriculture Developed
articles.content:
Nano-Germicide for Agriculture Developed
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The Nano Technology Research Team of the Academy of Agricultural Science of the DPRK recently developed nano-germicide for agriculture, drawing the attention of experts and farmers.
					 The germicide has marvelous efficacy for disinfecting rice greensickness, potato blight, cotton black patch and other diseases harmful to the growth of crops.
					
					 The rate of disinfection of various diseases of rice plant and vegetables is 90 to 95 percent on an average. It is also efficacious as disinfectant.
					
					 It is now widely applied to co-op farms in Pyongyang and South and North Hwanghae Provinces and many other units.

articles.title: Jangsan Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Jangsan Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors 
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The Jangsan Revolutionary Site in Ryonmot-dong, Sosong District in Pyongyang is drawing an endless stream of visitors on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.  
					 There are in the site relics telling about how Kim Jong Il took part in the project for expanding the Wasan-dong-Ryongsong road upholding the far-reaching plan of President Kim Il Sung for building the capital city during his revolutionary activities at Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 There is also the historic site where Kim Jong Il mounted Mt. Jang with students of Pyongyang Middle School No. 1 to plant trees to make a new history of forestation and guided military trainings of students of the then Pyongyang Namsan Senior Middle School and Kim Il Sung University several times.
					
					 This revolutionary site was opened to visitors on the occasion of February 16, 1977, the birthday of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The site has since been visited by at least 6.87 million servicepersons, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, foreign friends and overseas compatriots, according to data available.

articles.title: Koreans Inspired by Songs Reflecting Their Desire for Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans Inspired by Songs Reflecting Their Desire for Reunification
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Songs reflecting the Koreans' desire for reunification are popular in the DPRK.
					 A lot of songs of the theme of national reunification have been created over the past more than half century of Korea's division. 
					
					 "March for National Reunification", "River Rimjin" and other songs created in the 1950s reflect the will of the Koreans to drive foreign forces out of south Korea and achieve the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 "Train for Reunification Runs" is one of the songs created in the 1960s. It gives momentum to the Koreans' desire for reunification,
					
					  "Korea Is One" and "We Will Live Together with Our Fellow Countrymen" and other songs were produced in the 1970s and the 1980s.
					
					 The 1990s also witnessed the creation of many songs putting spurs to the Koreans' patriotic movement for reunification. Among them were "Double Swing for Reunification", "Rainbow for National Reunification", "Arirang of Reunification", "Ojak Bridge of Reunification", "Waltz for Reunification", "Song of Great Unity of Nation" and "Waltz for Great Unity of Nation."
					
					 "Brilliant Commander of Mt. Paektu Overlooks Land of Three Thousand-ri", "June 15 for Reunification", "We Are One" and other songs produced in the 2000s encourage the Korean people in their struggle for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Successful Trainer of Reserve Basketball Players
articles.content:
Successful Trainer of Reserve Basketball Players
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- There are a lot of educators in the DPRK who have successfully trained promising sports persons.
					 Among them is Yun Sol Hwa, 68, physical culture and sports teacher of Kang Pan Sok Secondary School.
					
					 She has trained at least 100 promising young basketball players for the last nearly four decades. 
					
					 Under her coaching, members of the basketball team of the school bagged many gold medals at more than 50 national and Pyongyang city boys matches among secondary schools.
					
					 Her onetime students are now active at the April 25 Sports Team, the Amnokgang Sports Team, the Pyongyang Sports Team and other famous sports teams in the country.
					
					 When interviewed by KCNA, Yun said: "I feel proud of being an educator whenever I look back on the successes gained in the past. I will do my best to train more promising young players in the days ahead to contribute to the nation's development of sports technique".

articles.title: Full Display of Spirit of WPK Conference Urged--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Full Display of Spirit of WPK Conference Urged--Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The spirit of the Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea should be strictly implemented to work continued miracles and feats in the ongoing general offensive and fully display the stamina of Songun Korea making leap forward. 
					 Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK, stresses this in an editorial Monday.
					
					 The editorial further says:
					
					 The spirit of the WPK Conference is the spirit of single-minded unity for keeping the centre of unity and leadership no matter how much water may flow under the bridge. It is also the indomitable spirit of forced march for building a prosperous and powerful country despite manifold trials and difficulties and the spirit of uninterrupted revolution for accomplishing the cause of revolution under the leadership of the Party. 
					
					 To implement this spirit is essential for giving full play to the invincible might of Songun Korea, where the leader, the army and people have become a harmonious whole, in the general offensive and for achieving a shining victory in the present advance of great surge for improvement of the people's living standard. 
					
					 All the Party members, soldiers and people should strictly implement the spirit in the general offensive and thus make the whole country wrapped in the flames of great revolutionary surge and spirit of great innovation and rapid progress. 
					
					 Steadfast is the faith and will of the army and people in the DPRK to glorify the present era of great surge with victory and glory and push ahead with the building of a thriving nation by strictly implementing the spirit.

articles.title: Improving North-South Relations Is Consistent Stand of DPRK
articles.content:
Improving North-South Relations Is Consistent Stand of DPRK
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is consistent in its stand to turn the north-south relations of distrust and confrontation into those of trust and reconciliation for national unity and reunification. This is also the requirement of the times.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 In order to improve the relations, it is prerequisite for the south Korean authorities to take the stand of attaching importance to the nation, away from the concept of escalating the deep-rooted confrontation with fellow countrymen, the article says, adding: 
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are sincerely concerned for the destiny of the nation and interested in the peace and reunification, they should not hesitate to improve the relations with the north. 
					
					 To terminate the political and military confrontation between the north and the south of Korea is essential for improving the relations.
					
					 Important here is to remove all political barriers lying in the way of improving them.
					
					 The "National Security Law" which brings the south Koreans pain and all other Koreans harms should be repealed at an early date and people from all walks of life be ensured political freedom and democratic rights including the right to discuss issues for the country's reunification and freedom of activities. 
					
					 The confrontation and tension between the north and the south are running high at present. What is urgent under this situation is to promote national reconciliation, cooperation and unity.
					
					 To this end, not only authorities but people from all walks of life in the north, the south and abroad should make active visits, contacts and cooperation.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration should be respected and thoroughly implemented under any circumstances. This is the principled stand of the DPRK.

articles.title: US Urged to Stop Projected War Exercises against DPRK
articles.content:
US Urged to Stop Projected War Exercises against DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification demanded the U.S. stop the moves for war exercises against the DPRK.
					 A commentary made public by it on Feb. 17 accused the U.S. of working hard to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises with the south Korean authorities with huge troops involved.
					
					 Last year the U.S. instigated the south Korean authorities to wage war maneuvers year-round under the pretext of Cheonan warship sinking, driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the phase of an all-out war, it said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. plan of war exercises reveals its attempt to escalate confrontation on the Korean Peninsula and put the finishing touches on the triangular military alliance with Japan and south Korea.
					
					 Its war scenario can never come true, the commentary said. It demanded the U.S. halt at once the planned exercises.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Action Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Action Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Political Parties and Civic and Social Organizations of south Korea at a press conference on Feb. 17 declared to take action against the "government".
					 A press release said that after its emergence the present regime has negated understanding with the people and deteriorated the people's living through misrule ridden by arrogance and self-righteousness.
					
					 The organization accused the regime of driving the economy to bankruptcy and letting violent organs and conservative media gag the people voicing democracy.
					
					 The regime sold off people's interests to foreign forces through sycophantic diplomacy and pushed the south-north relations to the worst phase through the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen, the organization deplored. The danger of war mounted on this land due to the treacherous act of the regime, it added.
					
					 The regime speaking for the interests of a handful of big businesses and conservative forces only cannot last long, it said. The people no longer count on the regime and the "Grand National Party," it added.
					
					 It said it would organize big action of opposition parties and civic and social organizations in Seoul on Feb. 25 to show the people's anger at the regime.

articles.title: Seoul City Authorities Denounced for Filing Damage Suit
articles.content:
Seoul City Authorities Denounced for Filing Damage Suit
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party of south Korea accused the Seoul City authorities of clamping down on candlelight demonstrators. Its spokesman issued a commentary on Feb. 18. 
					 It denounced the city authorities for filing a damage suit against those who took part in the candlelight actions. Damages they claim run to the tune of hundreds of million wons.
					
					 This is a violation of elementary freedom and rights of the people and wicked retaliation against the participants of the actions, it said, adding:
					
					 Not content with the police reckless suppression of them, the city authorities seek to impose heavy economic burden on them in a bid to calm down anti-"government" feelings.
					
					 It urged the authorities to immediately cancel the unreasonable suit.

articles.title: Chinese Premier Calls for Increased Grain Output
articles.content:
Chinese Premier Calls for Increased Grain Output
 Beijing, February 21 (KCNA) -- Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao, at a State Council meeting on Feb. 10, called for sincerely implementing the policy of boosting grain output.
					 He said a stable development of food and agricultural production is a prerequisite to relatively rapid economic growth and harmony of society.
					
					 For the development of food and agricultural production, it is necessary to take preventive measures against drought damage, make spring plowing preparations in a unified way, direct efforts to irrigation construction and increase investment in agricultural sector, he said.

articles.title: China Rejects US Interference in Internal Affairs
articles.content:
China Rejects US Interference in Internal Affairs 
Beijing, February 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson of the Chinese Foreign Ministry said at a press conference on Feb. 17 that the United States should refrain from interfering in internal affairs of China over internet access.
					The spokesperson reiterated the Chinese government's position that the freedom concerning Internet is guaranteed by law in the country.
					
					The remark serves as a warning to the U.S. against its demand for stopping website filter.

articles.title: Russia Takes Measure for Metropolitan Defense
articles.content:
Russia Takes Measure for Metropolitan Defense 
 Moscow, February 21 (KCNA) -- Russia has deployed S-400 Triumf air defense systems in a combined unit under the Strategic Command for Space Defense Operation in Moscow on Feb. 16.
					 The spokesman of the Information Department of the Defense Ministry said the air defense systems were deployed in Moscow for defending the sky above Moscow. 
					
					 "Such systems have already been used to defend the capital city of Moscow," he said. "Other kinds of systems are also planned to be deployed for metropolitan defense."

articles.title: No Raison d'etre for US Military Bases
articles.content:
No Raison d'etre for US Military Bases
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Former Japanese Prime Minister Yukio Hatoyama on Feb. 12 revealed the agreement reached at secret talks between Japan and the United States during his term of office over the relocation of the U.S. Futenma military base.
					 Speaking to Kyodo News, he said that the relocation outside Okinawa, one of his campaign pledges, ended with the transfer within the prefecture under the pretext of U.S. Marines' deterrence.
					
					 His remark reverses the allegation of the U.S. and Japanese authorities that U.S. forces are kept in Japan to deter others' threat.
					
					 Meanwhile, two U.S. congressmen, in interviews with Kyodo News on Feb. 15, called for the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Japan.
					
					 Republican Ron Paul said "deterrence" is nothing but an excuse to maintain military approach to northeast Asia.
					
					 Democrat Dennis Kucinich described the U.S. military presence in Japan as a "relic of the past".
					
					 The United States should rid itself of its military-first policy, he urged.
					
					 Like this, the injustice of the U.S. military presence in Japan and other northeast Asian regions is admitted by even high-ranking Japanese and U.S. politicians.
					
					 The United States should slough off its thinking pattern of the cold war style and take a substantial measure to withdraw its troops, the root cause of instability, from northeast Asia, including the Korean Peninsula and Japan.

articles.title: Japan's Ruling Party on Verge of Split-up
articles.content:
Japan's Ruling Party on Verge of Split-up
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The ruling Democratic Party of Japan (DPJ) is strained to the breaking point.
					 Sixteen dietmen supporting former party head Ichiro Ozawa announced on Feb. 17 that they would leave the DPJ and independent club in the House of Representatives.
					
					 They, in protest against the party leadership having suspended Ozawa from his party membership, are likely to vote against the government's 2011 budget bill and other bills related to the budget. They are also openly urging the prime minister to step down.
					
					 Japanese media are of the view that the government is at the crucial moment with attempts to topple the cabinet beginning to emerge within the ruling party.
					
					 Prime Minister Naoto Kan has refused to step down and threatened to dissolve the House of Representatives, rendering the political situation of Japan more instable.

articles.title: Europe's Space Vehicle Launched
articles.content:
Europe's Space Vehicle Launched
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- With the space development effort being intensified in many countries, Europe's second automated transfer vehicle (ATV-2) was launched by the workhorse Ariane 5 from French Guiana on Feb. 16.
					 Its mission is reportedly to resupply the International Space Station.

articles.title: Last Year's Natural Disasters Claim 300,000 Casualties
articles.content:
Last Year's Natural Disasters Claim 300,000 Casualties 
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Natural disasters claimed 300,000 casualties and loss worth $110 billion in the world last year, according to an announcement of the United Nations.
					 The typical disasters are earthquakes in Haiti, Chile and China, forest fires in Russia and the United States and typhoons in Asian countries. The victims of the natural disasters total 208 million.

articles.title: Increasing Imbalance between Worldwide Production of Food and Its Demand
articles.content:
Increasing Imbalance between Worldwide Production of Food and Its Demand
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- There is a serious imbalance between the worldwide production of grain and its demand, increasing the possibility of a sharp rise in its price.
					 At present analysts foresee that the grain production will decrease again this year in the wake of last year, boosting the demand for grain as compared with production. They predict that the worldwide decrease in grain production that has gone on in recent years will persist in the future, too.
					
					 A long spell of bad weather hit major grain producing countries last year, adversely affecting the grain production. This led to a fall in the worldwide grain stock. 
					
					 The dwindling grain production and stock and the increasing demand for it result in the sky-rocketing of its price. 
					
					 Analysts predict that the wheat and maize prices will keep rising this year as what happened in the latter half of last year. The price of polished rice is expected to jump higher than other grain.
					
					 Reality goes to prove that it is the only way for settling the food shortage for each country to develop its agriculture in the spirit of self-reliance and boost the grain production.
					
					 Many countries are now taking positive steps to solve the food shortage by doing farming well by their own efforts under any circumstances. 
					
					 Cooperation and exchanges are getting brisk among countries in the agricultural field.

articles.title: Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed by Newspapers in Various Countries
articles.content:
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Observed by Newspapers in Various Countries 
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups on the birthday of Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK.
					 In its early February issue the Venezuelan paper Tribuna Popular carried a feature article with a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper in the article titled "Kim Jong Il and Ideo-theoretical Experience of the DPRK" said that he has further strengthened the Workers' Party of Korea into the party which organizes and guides all victories of the Korean people.
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode of socialism, thus further strengthening the WPK to successfully accomplish the socialist cause despite whatever threat and challenge by the imperialists, it noted.
					
					 He authored celebrated works to indicate the orientation and ways for rapidly developing the country's economy, it said, adding: The remarkable successes made in various fields of the DPRK's economy are clear proof of the validity and vitality of his idea and theory on serving the people.
					
					 The February 12th issue of the Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya said in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il and His Birthday": February 16, the greatest holiday for the Korean people, has turned to a day when all of them enjoy great happiness and joy under the blessing of their leader rather than a day when he enjoys the blessing of all people.
					
					 The February-March issue of the British paper Proletarian carried an article supporting the DPRK's stand for peace.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Peru
 Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centered on the Masses Shall Not Perish" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house of Peru on Feb. 8.
					 The work, published on May 5, 1991, tells about the inevitability of the triumph of the socialist cause and the secret of solidity and invincibility of Korean-style socialism. It also comprehensively expounds that Korean socialism embodies the great Juche idea and it is the best social system providing the popular masses with an independent and creative life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Italy, Norway and Bulgaria on Feb. 8 and 10 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy said that Kim Jong Il realized the long-cherished desire of the Korean people to lead a dignified life in a politico-ideological and military power. Under his guidance Korean socialism will emerge victorious and a thriving socialist nation is sure to be built in Korea, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Norway said that the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il serves as a decisive guarantee that helps the Korean people build a great, prosperous and powerful socialist nation, overcoming the persistent provocation by the imperialists and the serious economic difficulties.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea has advanced invariably holding aloft the banner of socialism in any adversity, and this is a great encouragement to all the progressive political parties the world over, he said, adding: Our Party will as ever extend steadfast support and solidarity to the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 Thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have victoriously advanced along the road chosen by them under the banner of Juche, said the vice-chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de viceministro chino de RR.EE.
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de viceministro chino de RR.EE
  Pyongyang, 21 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dedicaran el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores de China, Zhang Zhijun, y su comitiva de visita en Corea. 
					  El visitante lo entrego el dia 21 a Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Zhang Zhijun
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Zhang Zhijun
Pyongyang, 21 de febrero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 21 en un ambiente amistoso con el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores de China, Zhang Zhijun, y su comitiva en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae.
					En la ocasion, Zhang Zhijun deseo al pueblo coreano lograra mayores exitos en la construccion del socialismo bajo la sabia guia del Dirigente    Kim Jong Il.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises se desarrollaran mas en varios sectores.

articles.title: Conversan en Pyongyang vicecancilleres de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversan en Pyongyang vicecancilleres de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 21 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 20 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre el primer vicecanciller coreano Kim Kye Gwan y el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores de China, Zhang Zhijun.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro Kim Song Gi y otros funcionarios del MINREX y, por la china, la comitiva del viceministro ejecutivo, el embajador Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica china en Corea.
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad Corea-China y otros temas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Acto central por el 10o aniversario de fallecimiento de Han Tok Su
articles.content:
Acto central por el 10o aniversario de fallecimiento de Han Tok Su
Pyongyang, 21 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto central por el 10o aniversario del fallecimiento de Han Tok Su, ex presidente del Presidium del Comite Central de la Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon (Chongryon).
					  Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Yang Gon, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, el presidente del CC del Partido Social-Democrata de Corea, Kim Yong Dae, los funcionarios de los organismos del poder, entidades sociales y religiosas, organos de educacion, ministerios y organos centrales, los familiares del difunto, trabajadores capitalinos, los funcionarios de la Chongryon y otros compatriotas residentes en Japon quienes estan de visita en la patria socialista. 
					
					  Han Tok Su, nacido en una pobre familia campesina del distrito de Kyongsan de la provincia de Kyongsang del Norte, organizo y condujo el movimiento obrero por defender el derecho a la vida de la comunidad coreana en Japon. 
					
					  Una vez liberada la patria, ateniendose al mensaje del Presidente Kim Il Sung "Al millon de compatriotas residentes en el Japon", lucho con energia por agrupar a los compatriotas en torno al Presidente y dedico todo lo suyo a la causa patriotica de construir una nueva patria. 
					
					  Constituyo la Chongryon y trabajo durante 46 anos como presidente de esta entidad de ciudadanos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en ultramar.
					
					   Al pronunciar el discurso de la ocasion, Yang Hyong Sop recordo el gran aporte de Han al desarrollo del movimiento de compatriotas ultramarinos. 
					
					  Aunque vivia en el extranjero, compartio siempre las alegrias y las penas con la patria socialista (RPDC) considerandola como regazo de madre, destaco.
					
					  La noble vida y las proezas de lucha de Han Tok Su, verdadero hijo de la nacion quien avanzo a pasos firmes de siglo en siglo por el camino patriotico siguiendo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, quedaran registradas para siempre en los anales de la patria junto con la causa revolucionaria del Juche y la patriotica de la Chongryon, concluyo.

articles.title: Clausurado el XV Festival de Kimjongilias
articles.content:
Clausurado el XV Festival de Kimjongilias
Pyongyang, 21 de febrero (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurado este lunes en la Exposicion Permanente de Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia el XV Festival de Kimjongilias, inaugurado el dia 14 con motivo del cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					En la ocasion participaron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, y otros funcionarios correspondientes, los funcionarios de los ministerios y oganos centrales, militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea, trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares y el grupo de felicitacion de coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					En su discurso de clausura, el ministro de Cultura An Tong Chun hizo referencia al transcurso solemne del festival como el del elogio al gran hombre y destaco la necesidad de intensificar en el futuro tambien el intercambio y la cooperacion compartiendo los exitos y experiencias logrados en el cultivo y la difusion de Kimjongilias, de modo que estas flores florezcan plenamente.
